comments.author: dork.fish.wat@gmail.com
comments.creator: dork.fish.wat@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0

Although the window is drawn upside down, the buttons are still in their proper places and can be interacted with if you can figure out where to click. It just seems to be a rendering error.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to Options->Advanced
2. Uncheck "Use hardware acceleration when available"
3. ???
4. Firefox draws upside down!

Actual Results:  
See this screenshot: http://imgur.com/27yUG

Expected Results:  
Hardware accelerated drawing should be disabled.

Quitting Firefox and relaunching it clears the issue.

Expected Results:

Quitting Firefox and relaunching it clears the issue.
Please post the Content of the Graphics Section you can get via "about:support" with enabled Hardware Acceleration.

I didn't realize my driver was so ancient, as I ran Microsoft Update the other day and it said it had updated the video driver. I can see about updating using the official download on the Nvidia page.

Justin: Ha. You must be Australian.
